DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS TOXIC SUBSTANCES CONTROL ACT (TSCA)   306 FUNDED GRANT IS TO PROVIDE RADON RISK REDUCTION THAT WILL RESULT IN INCREASED RADON TESTING, MITIGATION, AND RADON RESISTANT NEW CONSTRUCTION.  UNIVERSITY OF NEVADA COOPERATIVE EXTENSION'S (NSHE) NEVADA RADON EDUCATION PROGRAM'S (NREP) STRENGTHS ARE IN ITS PUBLIC EDUCATION, NETWORKING ABILITIES, DATA COLLECTION AND OUTREACH. THE STATEWIDE PROGRAM EDUCATES NEVADANS ABOUT THE HEALTH RISKS OF RADON, THE PRIMARY CAUSE OF LUNG CANCER AMONG NONSMOKERS IN THE U.S., SO CITIZENS CAN MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS TO LOWER THEIR RISK. TESTING IS THE ONLY WAY TO DETERMINE IF A HOME HAS A PROBLEM. BECAUSE NEVADA LACKS REGULATIONS CONCERNING TESTING, FIXING AND BUILDING NEW HOMES RADON-RESISTANT, THE ONLY WAY CITIZENS LEARN ABOUT THE RISK IS THROUGH EDUCATION. SINCE INCEPTION, THE PROGRAM HAS HELPED EDUCATE NEVADANS BY PROVIDING LOW-COST OR FREE TEST KITS, INFORMATION, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, PROGRAMS, PRESENTATIONS AND LITERATURE. THE PROGRAM PROVIDES MEASUREMENT AND MITIGATION ADVICE TO HOMEOWNERS, INITIATES PUBLIC OUTREACH AND INNOVATIVE INFORMATIONAL ACTIVITIES, PROMOTES THE USE OF RADON-RESISTANT NEW CONSTRUCTION, TESTING IN REAL ESTATE TRANSACTIONS, AND BUILDS PARTNERSHIPS WITH OTHER INTERESTED GROUPS, AS WELL AS PROVIDES PROGRAM MANAGEMENT. ALL ACTIVITIES ARE IN SUPPORT OF THE EPA STRATEGIC GOAL 1, CLEAN AIR AND GOAL 2, HEALTHIER INDOOR AIR.  THE OUTCOME OF THESE MEASURES IS TO SAVE NEVADANS LIVES BY REDUCING EXPOSURE TO RADON AND REDUCING RADON INDUCED LUNG CANCER DEATHS.

BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED EXPOSURE TO RADON AND DECREASED RISK OF LUNG CANCER. AS A CURRENT PARTNER TO INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH (IDOH) AND THE U.S. ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (USEPA), ALA HAS DEVELOPED A COMPREHENSIVE WORK PLAN FOR THE INDIANA SIRG GRANT TO SUPPORT THE REDUCTION OF RADON RISK TO INDIANA RESIDENTS BY BUILDING UPON EXISTING AND SUCCESSFUL ALA RADON PROGRAMS, INCLUDING: THE OPERATION OF AN INDIANA RADON HOTLINE WITH LIVE RESPONDERS; A LOW-COST RADON TEST KIT PROGRAM FOR RESIDENTS AND A FREE TEST KIT PROGRAM FOR LOCAL HEALTH DEPARTMENTS (LHD) AND SCHOOL TESTING PROGRAM; THEY WILL MANAGE A RADON DIGITAL MEDIA CAMPAIGN FOR INDIANA MANAGE THE INDIANA RADON POSTER CONTEST; AND PROMOTE RADON RESISTANT NEW CONSTRUCTION (RRNC) OUTREACH TO BUILDERS. OUTCOMES:THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE A BROADENED AWARENESS OF RISK RELATED TO RADON, EXPANDED ACCESS TO RADON SERVICES, AND ADVANCED RADON RISK REDUCTION THROUGH HOUSING FINANCE AND BUILDING CODES. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE INDIANA RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED EXPOSURE TO RADON AND DECREASED RISK OF LUNG CANCER. 

ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: 1) REVISE THE RADON PORTION OF THE INDIANA STATE CANCER CONTROL PLAN TO REFLECT PROGRESS MADE; 2) ATTEND REAL ESTATE COMMISSION BOARD MEETING EACH YEAR; 3) IDENTIFY OPPORTUNITIES TO TRAIN OR PROVIDE LITERATURE ON RADON TESTING AND MITIGATION TO REALTORS; 4) INCREASE THE NUMBER OF VISITORS AND UNIQUE VISITORS TO THE ISDH RADON PAGE; 5) INCREASE THE NUMBER OF TEST KITS PURCHASED; 6) IDENTIFY TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES; 7) RECRUIT CONTRACTORS CURRENTLY BUILDING, OR WILLING TO PILOT BUILDING RRNC HOMES; 8) FIELD INSPECT ROUGHLY 50 HOMES.
